lines.content: - Aligning the text dynamically to the right
- Splitting the various tests into multiple files to test a specific feature in each file along with the edge cases
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Carrot. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
2. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
2. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
3. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
3. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

4. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Carrot.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Carrot.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
public static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<Task>(LISTSIZE);
public static void argsCheck(String[] inputs, int numArgs) {
public static void echo(Scanner input) throws CarrotException {
System.out.printf("Error: The index to mark/unmark was not specified. Please type '%s [task number]'%n", inputs[0]);
System.out.printf("Error: There is %d items currently in the list. Please type '%s [task number]' where task number is less than %d or add to the list first%n", currentSize, inputs[0], currentSize);
System.out.printf("Error: Too many or too few arguments. Please type '%s [task number]'%n", inputs[0]);
System.out.printf("Error: Too many or too few arguments. Please type 'event [event name] /from [start date] /to [end date]'%n");
System.out.printf("Error: Too many or too few arguments. Please type 'deadline [task] /by [due date]'%n");
System.out.printf("Error: Too many or too few arguments. Please type 'todo [task]'%n");
System.out.println("Error: The index to delete was not specified. Please type 'delete [task number]'");
System.out.printf("Error: Too many or too few arguments. Please type 'delete [task number]'%n");
System.out.println("An error has occurred, exiting program");
System.out.printf("%" + Prints.seperator.length() + "s%n", "New Deadline Alert: " + this.taskName + " by " + this.dueDate);
public Event(String taskName, String startDate, String endDate) {
System.out.printf("%" + Prints.seperator.length() + "s%n", "New Event Alert: " + this.taskName + " occurring from " + this.startDate + " to " + this.endDate);
System.out.println("Hello! I'm C4RR0T\nWhat can I do for you?");
System.out.printf("%" + seperator.length() + "s%n", "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
public static void printTaskList(ArrayList<Task> list, int currentSize) {
System.out.printf("%" + seperator.length() + "s%n", "hmmmmm, I can't seem to find a command for that");
System.out.printf("%" + seperator.length() + "s%n", "Try screaming \"help\" for the full list of commands");
REM create bin directory if it doesn't exist
REM delete output from previous run
REM compile the code into the bin folder
REM Check if setup file exists
echo Error: Setup file not found at %SETUP_FILE%
REM Loop through all test files in 'tests' folder starting with test_
REM A. Merge Setup + Test Case
REM Check if expected file exists
echo Warning: Missing expected file for %%f. Skipping.
REM C. Run Java (Carrot) with Error Capture
# create bin directory if it doesn't exist
# compile the code into the bin folder, terminates if error occurred
echo "  Error: Setup file not found at $SETUP_FILE"
# Loop through all test files in 'tests' folder
# Check if expected file exists before running
echo "  Missing expected file for $test_file. Skipping."
# C. Run Java (Using the MERGED input, capturing errors with 2>&1)
# Create UNIX version of expected output
exit 1 # Stop immediately on first failure
